name: expectably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that can be expected: It is important not to do anything that will be expectably damaging to the child's interests. We need to think about actions that would make the outcome expectably better. Related word
expectable
More examplesFewer examplesIf your symptoms persist after they would expectably have disappeared, you should speak to your doctor.People who have experienced a traumatic event could expectably suffer from anxiety.Experiments show that the machine can expectably achieve greater accuracy at much lower cost.The expectably pregnant cows could be separated from those that are unlikely to be pregnant.
